caption: Israeli soldiers checked bodies in Kfar Azza, a village near Gaza, on Tuesday. The scale of the horror was rapidly coming into focus.
image_1.context: Then I saw the legs of a bloated corpse dressed in fatigues poking out from under a bush, and beside it a khaki vest with the insignia of a commando unit of Hamas, the group that controls the Palestinian coastal enclave, and staged KFAR AZZA, Israel — “Welcome,” said the sign at the entrance to Kfar Azza, a lush Israeli village just across some fields from the border with Gaza. On the pathway, another sign pointed the way to the gym and the swimming pool. By ISABEL KERSHNER In Rows of Tidy Houses, Carnage in a Kibbutz at Gaza’s Doorstep VOL. CLXXIII . . . . No. 59,938 © 2023 The New York Times Company WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 11, 2023
image_1.description: The image depicts a scene of Israeli soldiers in a village near Gaza, specifically Kfar Azza. The soldiers are dressed in military uniforms and helmets, with some kneeling and others standing. They appear to be handling black body bags, which are lined up on the ground. The soldiers are engaged in what seems to be a somber task, possibly checking or preparing bodies for transport. In the background, there is a military truck with visible markings and equipment. The setting includes a dirt area with some trees and a building, suggesting a rural or semi-rural environment. The atmosphere conveyed is one of tension and gravity, reflecting the serious nature of the situation. The soldiers' postures and the presence of body bags indicate a tragic event has occurred.

image_2.context: After years in which support for Israel had turned into an increasingly partisan issue in Washington, Democratic and Republican leaders in recent days have generally responded with broad condemnation of Hamas and expressions of solidarity following the slaughter of hundreds of WASHINGTON — The staggering Hamas surprise attack on Israel has done what Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu never could — united America’s fractious politicians behind his nation again. Sort of. Mostly. For now. By PETER BAKER NEWS ANALYSIS Mobilizing 360,000 U.S. Leaders Unify, Troops as Toll at Least for Now Mounts ISRAEL TAKES BACK TOWNS, PREPARING TO GO ON OFFENSE  in.  Israel has said its strikes are targeting all sites connected with Hamas, the armed Palestinian group that controls the Gaza Strip, including the homes of members. Israel said it believes Hamas members are hiding in homes, schools and hospitals. Hamas members are Palestinians from Gaza, so they live among the community. But the Israeli strikes have shocked Palestinians. Israel has given general warnings for people to leave certain neighborhoods or towns, but has acknowledged they are not as extensive or speDestruction in Gaza City. Israel says its strikes are targeting all sites connected with Hamas, including mosques and hospitals.
image_2.description: The image depicts a scene of destruction in Gaza City. In the foreground, there are several people walking through a debris-strewn area. The debris consists of rubble and remnants of buildings that have been destroyed. Among the people, one individual is wearing a blue shirt and appears to be holding a phone or camera, possibly documenting the scene. Another person is dressed in traditional clothing, suggesting a cultural context. In the background, there is a partially collapsed building with visible damage and smoke rising from the ruins. Adjacent to this building is another structure that appears to be intact but surrounded by debris. The sky is clear, indicating daytime. The overall atmosphere conveys a sense of devastation and aftermath following a significant event, likely related to conflict or attack.

caption: Gathering for a funeral of a festivalgoer on Tuesday.
image_3.context: Rape, Race and Years-Old  Continued on Page A11 Continued on Page A13 Mr. Biden said that the United States would provide intelligence to help save hostages held by Hamas. But he did not suggest that American troops would directly assist with hostage rescue missions. Hamas is holding Americans hostage, President Biden said on Tuesday, and 14 Americans were confirmed to be among those killed. He called the attacks “pure unadulterated evil.” Soldiers and rescue workers said scores, possibly hundreds, had been killed there, including infants and children, suggesting the death toll from the weekend alone would almost certainly keep rising.  every corner of the country of 10 million, which has been plunged into anguish by the killing of more than 1,000 people in the attacks since Saturday. With the border nearly secured on Tuesday — even as rocket attacks from Gaza continued and some firefights broke out — the scale of the horror unleashed on towns and villages near Gaza was rapidly coming into focus. In one kibbutz a mile and a half from Gaza, journalists with The New York Times saw Israeli soldiers carrying slain residents on stretchers, and more than a dozen bloated bodies lying on the ground.
image_3.description: The image depicts a somber gathering of people, likely at a funeral or memorial service. The central focus is on two young women who are embracing each other, their faces showing signs of grief and distress. One of the women has her eyes closed, while the other looks downward with a pained expression. They are surrounded by a crowd of people, some of whom are also visibly emotional. A man in traditional Jewish attire, including a black hat and beard, stands to the left, adding to the cultural context of the scene. The background is filled with more people, some wearing sunglasses, indicating it is a sunny day. The overall atmosphere is one of mourning and shared sorrow, as the individuals appear to be consoling each other during a difficult time. The setting suggests a communal response to a tragic event, possibly related to the context provided about a festivalgoer's funeral.

image_4.context: Green Energy in Wyoming One man’s quest to lure climate investment from the wealthy enclave of Jackson underscores how the climate law works: It runs on rich people. PAGE A14 Santos Faces New Charges Federal prosecutors say Representative George Santos got money from donors’ credit cards without asking. PAGE A19 gene-edited chickens were exposed to very high doses of the virus, the researchers found. And when the scientists edited just one chicken gene, the virus quickly adapted. The findings suggest that creating flu-resistant chickens will require editing multiple genes and that scientists will need to proceed carefully to avoid driving further evolution of the virus, the study’s authors said.  The research is “proof of concept that we can move toward making chickens resistant to the virus,” Wendy Barclay, a virologist at Imperial College London and an author of the study, said at a news briefing. “But we’re not there yet.”
image_4.description: The image depicts a yellow school bus partially submerged in floodwaters. The bus is positioned at an angle, with the front end slightly higher than the rear. The water level reaches approximately halfway up the wheels of the bus. The bus has its lights on, indicating it may be active or recently used. The surrounding area appears to be a road or path that is heavily flooded, with water extending beyond the width of the bus. In the background, there are trees and what seems to be a hill or elevated terrain, suggesting this might be a rural or suburban area. The sky is overcast, contributing to a somber and tense atmosphere. The scene conveys a sense of emergency and disruption, likely due to severe weather conditions.

image_5.description: The image shows a close-up of a freshly prepared quesadilla or similar stuffed flatbread, presented on a wooden serving board. The quesadilla is cut into four triangular pieces, revealing a filling that includes melted cheese and possibly spinach or another green leafy vegetable. The bread appears golden brown and crispy, with some areas showing a darker, more toasted texture. The cheese is stringy and has a bright yellow color, indicating it might be cheddar or a similar type of cheese. To the left of the quesadilla, there is a small bowl containing a white dipping sauce, which could be sour cream or a yogurt-based dip. The overall presentation is appetizing and suggests a homemade or artisanal preparation.

image_6.description: The image is a black and white photograph capturing a dynamic scene of a breakdancer performing. The central figure, a man with an afro hairstyle, is in the midst of a dance move, balancing on one hand while his body is elevated off the ground. He is wearing loose-fitting pants and a shirt that appears to be tucked in at the waist. His posture is athletic and expressive, conveying a sense of movement and energy. The background shows a crowd of people, some standing and others sitting, watching the performance. The floor is covered with newspapers or posters, which are common in breakdancing to provide a smooth surface for the dancer. The overall atmosphere is lively and focused on the performance, with the audience's attention centered on the breakdancer. The monochromatic tone of the image adds a timeless quality to the scene.
